title: Geometric Mnemic Manifolds: A Position Paper - Toward Structured Memory Architectures for Persistent AI Agency
description: A position paper presenting the Geometric Mnemic Manifold (GMM), a proposed memory architecture for large language models with formal complexity proofs, honest assessment of claims, and a concrete validation roadmap. This work distinguishes proven mathematical properties from conjectures, identifies critical validation gates, and frames GMM as a research agenda rather than a proven solution. Version 3.0 emphasizes epistemic clarity, corrects overclaimed complexity bounds, and provides a four-phase experimental roadmap for empirical validation.
references: Tulving, E. (1985). Memory and consciousness. Canadian Psychology, 26(1), 1-12.
Park, J. S., et al. (2023). Generative Agents: Interactive Simulacra of Human Behavior. UIST.
